experiences.name: Materials Intelligence Lab, LG AI Research
Visual Information Processing Lab, Seoul National University
experiences.summary: Molecular Representation Learning: Developed methods to utilize molecular motifs and chemical reaction data to train molecular representation. Aided in developing physics-informed molecular representation and published a research paper in UAI 2023.;Object Segmentation: Proposed a topic for computer vision class project and led a team of four students in developing novel decoding architecture for Camouflaged Object Detection (COD) task. Achieved state-of-the-art performances in COD task and submitted a research paper to CVPR 2024.;XAI in Drug Discovery: Currently working on developing visualization framework for drug screening models to enhance explainability of AI-based drug discovery research.

experiences.name: Catalysis and Process Integration Group, University of Cambridge
experiences.summary: Worked in the process integration and catalysis lab as part of final year research project as an undergraduate researcher for over 15 hours per week.;Focused on the role of ruthenium nanoparticles as ammonia decomposition catalyst and using a continuous flow reactor to produce ruthenium nanoparticles with controlled sizes.;Successfully created ruthenium nanoparticle catalyst comparable to the state-of-art used for ammonia decomposition, which can be a stepping stone in utilizing ammonia as a safe and cost-effective storage solution for storing hydrogen.

experiences.name: Smart Factory Team, Hyosung ITX
experiences.summary: Worked with statistical analysts in the smart factory team, developing statistical analysis tools, such as process management system and alarm management system. Provided these tools to various chemical factories in Korea and China, such as the Spandex factory in Guangdong, China.;Programmed extensively in R language and created several data analysis libraries to be used in the team using R language, such as change point detection, distribution classification, and basic statistical analysis libraries.;Aided in creating English manual guides for the process management and alarm analysis tools to be used in the Guangdong Spandex factory developed by the team.

volunteer.summary: Lead organizer for the New York City branch of the People's Climate March, the largest climate march in history.
highlights: Awarded 'Climate Hero' award by Greenpeace for my efforts organizing the march.
Men of the year 2014 by Time magazine

education.studyType: BA and MEng in Chemical Engineering

awards.title: United Steel Companies Scholarship
awards.summary: Awarded £400 scholarship for excellent examination performance.

publications.name: Zur Elektrody/namik bewegter Körper
publications.summary: It concerned an interpretation of the Michelson–Morley experiment and the properties of light and time. Special relativity incorporates the principle that the speed of light is the same for all inertial observers regardless of the state of motion of the source.

publications.name: Über einen die Erzeugung und Verwandlung des Lichtes betreffenden heuristischen Gesichtspunkt
publications.summary: In the second paper, he applied the quantum theory to light to explain the photoelectric effect. In particular, he used the idea of light quanta (photons) to explain experimental results, but stressed the importance of the experimental results. The importance of his work on the photoelectric effect earned him the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1921.

publications.name: Die Grundlage der allgemeinen Relativitätstheorie
publications.summary: The publication of the theory of general relativity made him internationally famous. He was professor of physics at the universities of Zurich (1909–1911) and Prague (1911–1912), before he returned to ETH Zurich (1912–1914).

projects.name: Quantum Computing
projects.summary: Quantum computing is the use of quantum-mechanical phenomena such as superposition and entanglement to perform computation. Computers that perform quantum computations are known as quantum computers.
